info.name: Identity PAM SCIM [PUBLIC]
info.description:
# Introduction

The CyberArk Identity SCIM (System for Cross-Domain Identity Management) server provides API endpoints for SCIM-compliant clients (for example, an Identity and Access Governance solution such as Sailpoint) to manage privileged accounts and its related objects in CyberArk Privilege Cloud.

# Overview

The CyberArk Identity SCIM server currently supports the following endpoints to manage privileged accounts and related objects.

Note Managing Users or Groups in Privilege Cloud or PAS requires the SCIM service user to be in a role with the Vault Management Administrative Right. Refer to SCIM Server configuration for more information.

Refer to Privilege Cloud or PAS documentation for details on supported request methods for each endpoint.

Privilege Cloud Documentation: [https://docs.cyberark.com/Product-Doc/OnlineHelp/PrivCloud/Latest/en/Content/Resources/_TopNav/cc_Home.htm](https://docs.cyberark.com/Product-Doc/OnlineHelp/PrivCloud/Latest/en/Content/Resources/_TopNav/cc_Home.htm)

Privilege Access Manager Documentation: [https://docs.cyberark.com/Product-Doc/OnlineHelp/PAS/Latest/en/Content/Resources/_TopNav/cc_Home.htm](https://docs.cyberark.com/Product-Doc/OnlineHelp/PAS/Latest/en/Content/Resources/_TopNav/cc_Home.htm)

# Authentication

Provide an existing Oauth2 Bearer Token or provide a Username and Secret capable of requesting a new Bearer Token via the Authentication request.

# Status Codes

## Status Coder Overview

| Status Name | Status Code | Status Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Success | 200 | The request succeeded. The actual response will depend on the request method used. |
| Created | 201 | The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created. |
| Bad Request | 400 | The request could not be understood by the server due to incorrect syntax. |
| Unauthorized | 401 | The request requires user authentication. |
| Forbidden | 403 | The server received and understood the request, but will not fulfill it. Authorization will not help and the request MUST NOT be repeated. |
| Not Found | 404 | The server did not find anything that matches the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent. |
| Conflict | 409 | The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource. |
| Internal Server Error | 500 | The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request. |

## Error Code Breakdown

#### 400 Bad Request

Encountered primarily in GET, POST, and PATCH Operations for all REST API End Points. Reasons include:

*   GET - You may receive this error in a GET request when attempting to use a filter where the filter query has a hyphen or space and the query is not enclosed in quotation marks.
*   POST - You may receive this error when attempting a POST if you are missing a required parameter in the body of the POST.
*   PATCH - You may receive this error when attempting a PATCH if you have a parameter that does not exist in the Body of the PATCH (e.g. Incorrect Platform Id in the PATCH Operation).
    

#### 404 Not Found

Encountered primarily in GET, POST, and PATCH Operations for all REST API End Points. Reasons include:

*   GET - You may receive this error in a GET request specifically if trying to perform a GET by Name or Id and providing a Name or Id that does not exist.
*   POST - You may receive this error when attempting a POST if you are missing a required parameter in the body of the POST. This typically only occurs with the ContainerPermissions endpoint if a parameter in the body is misspelled (e.g. User - displayName is incorrect).
*   PUT - You may receive this error in a PUT operation if there is an attribute mismatch (e.g. the resource ID in the URL does not match the resource Id in the JSON Body)
*   DEL - You may receive this error when attempting a DELETE operation if the resource does not exist.
    

#### 409 Conflict

Encountered only in POST Operations for all REST API End Points. Reasons include:

*   POST - If you attempt to process the same POST operation twice you will receive a 409 conflict as the Resource will already exist.
    

#### 500 Internal Server Error

Encountered primarily in GET, POST, PUT, and PATCH Operations for all REST API End Points. The primary reason is normally the permissions assigned to the Identity SCIM User and if this is the case will return a JSON with "Forbidden" in the details. Additionally, you may receive no JSON in response and instead receive and HTML document in certain situations (often attribute mismatch or errors). Additional reasons include:

*   GET - You may receive this error in a GET request when trying to filter by an attribute that does not exist for the resource type or if the Identity SCIM User does not have the appropriate authorizations.
*   POST - You may receive this error when attempting a POST operation if the Identity SCIM User does not have the appropriate authorizations.
*   PUT - You may receive this error in a PUT operation if there is an attribute mismatch (e.g. the displayName is misspelled in the PUT Body) or if the Identity SCIM User does not have the appropriate authorizations.
*   PATCH - You may receive this error in a PATCH operation when attempting an invalid operation (e.g. Delete)
*   DEL - You may receive this error when attempting a DELETE operation if the Identity SCIM user does not have the appropriate permissions on the resource.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to obtain information relating to all users in Vault, including the user's id attribute that you need for PUT, and DELETE requests.

#### Query Parameters

*   Index:
    *   Returns users specified by an index. Useful when there are large number of returned resources to control pagination.
        *   startIndex: initial starting offset for returned resources.
        *   count: total count of returned resources.
    *   Example: Return users 10 through 13 using index.
        *   `GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Users?startIndex=10&count=5`
*   Sort:
    *   Returns all resources sorted either ascending (default) or descending based on a resource attribute.
        *   sortBy: resource attribute to sort by.
        *   sortOrder: ascending (default) or descending.
    *   Example: Return users sorted by *userName* in *ascending* order.
        *   `GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Users?sortBy=userName&sortOrder=ascending`
*   Filter:
    *   Returns a single resource specified by the filter in the response.
    *   Example: Return a single user based on the *userName* filter.
        *   `GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Users?filter=userName eq "Administrator"`
*   Attributes:
    *   Returns only the specified attributes in the JSON response.
    *   Example: Return all Users with only userName and displayName.
        *   `GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Users&attributes=userName,displayName`

request.description:
The DELETE request deletes a single user specified in the SCIM URL. You can only delete a single user. Trying to delete all users results in an error.

DELETE is the only request that does not return a response. Running DELETE twice receives an error; you cannot delete a user if the user ID no longer exists in Vault.

**Valid Examples:**

Delete user with User Id = 1:

`DELETE https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Users/1`

item.description:
## User Management

CyberArk Identity allows you to manage User objects in the Vault through the scim/Users/ endpoint. Supported requests include:

*   GET: access user information
*   POST: add new users
*   PUT: update the information of existing users
*   DELETE: delete users
*   LINKEDOBJECT
    

The CyberArk Identity SCIM server supports the SCIM User core schema. To address use cases which need management of additional custom attributes for user objects that are not part of the SCIM User core schema, the CyberArk Identity SCIM server provides support for the custom schema (urn:scim:schemas:extension:custom:2.0).

In addition, CyberArk Identity supports attributes defined by the LinkedObject schema. These attributes are available only through GET requests - you can't modify them. Refer to [https://tools.ietf.org/id/draft-grizzle-scim-pam-ext-01.html#linked-object](https://tools.ietf.org/id/draft-grizzle-scim-pam-ext-01.html#linked-object) for more information.

For testing the above methods, you need to send a header with a bearer token for authentication (retrieved through Actions in your SCIM App Settings) and a tenant ID for navigating to the correct endpoint. When you update User attributes using the Users/ endpoint, be sure to specify the schema in the request payload.

The following should be included in any request to the "Users" endpoint:  
`"schemas": [ "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User" ],`

### **User Attributes**

| **Attribute** | **Description** | **Data Type** | **Filter?** | **Sort By?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| userName | User Name | String | Supported (1) | Supported |
| displayName | User Display Name | String | Supported | Supported |
| userType | System User Type (e.g. BuiltIn-Admins, EPVUser, etc..) | String | Supported | Supported |
| active | User Enabled or Disabled | Boolean | Supported | Supported |
| **groups** | Groups that user is a member of. | Array Complex | \- | \- |
| *.type* | Groups Sub Attribute - Group Type (e.g. Vault or LDAP) | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| *.display* | Groups Sub Attribute - Group Display Name | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| *.value* | Groups Sub Attribute - Group Id | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| *.$ref* | Groups Sub Attribute - Group Endpoint URL | String | Supported (2) | Not Supported |
| **name** | User Name Fields | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.givenName* | Name Sub Attribute - First Name | String | Supported | Supported |
| *.middleName* | Name Sub Attribute - Middle Name | String | Supported | Supported |
| *.familyName* | Name Sub Attribute - Last Name | String | Supported | Supported |
| *.formatted* | Name Sub Attribute - Formatted Name | String | Supported | Supported |
| entitlements | User's entitlements | Array | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| id | Unique User Id | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| schemas | User Schemas | Array | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| meta | User Metadata | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.resourceType* | Static - "User" | String | Supported | Supported |
| *meta.created* | Date Created - YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.######Z | String | Not Supported | Supported |
| *.lastModified* | Date Last Modified - YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.######Z | String | Not Supported | Supported |
| *.location* | Resource Location URL | String | Supported | Supported |
| **urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:cyberark:1.0:User** | Core User Information | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.directoryType* | User Sub Attribute - (e.g Vault) | string | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| **urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:pam:1.0:LinkedObject** | Contains External Directory Information | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.source* | LinkedObject Sub Attribute - User Source (e.g. LDAP) | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.nativeIdentifier* | LinkedObject Sub Attirbute - User Native Identifier (e.g. CN=xyz,dc=abc,dc=com) | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| **urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User** | Contains Enterprise User Information | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.organization* | Enterprise User Sub Attribute - Organization | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.department* | Enterprise User Sub Attribute - Department | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |

#### Notes

*   *(1) Case Sensitive*
*   *(2) You should enclose the attribute path in quotes to avoid Url encoding issues (e.g. "groups.$ref")*
    

### **Custom schema requirements**

Note the following pre-requisites for using the custom SCIM schema.

*   The SCIM schema must be specified in the request payload.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to obtain information relating to all groups in Vault. Group names, users involved in the group, and group specifications are outlined in the response.

#### Permissions Required

*   User Rights
    *   Audit Users

#### Query Parameters

*   **Index:**
    *   Returns resources specified by an index. Useful when there are large number of returned resources to control pagination.
        *   startIndex: initial starting offset for returned resources.
        *   count: total count of returned resources. (**NOTE: Pagination is currently not working for Groups)**
    *   Example: Return users 10 through 13 using index.
        *   `GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Groups?startIndex=10&count=5`
*   **Sort:**
    *   Returns all resources sorted either ascending (default) or descending based on a resource attribute.
        *   sortBy: resource attribute to sort by.
        *   sortOrder: ascending (default) or descending.
    *   Example: Return Groups sorted by *displayName* in *ascending* order.
        *   `GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Groups?sortBy=displayName&sortOrder=ascending`
*   **Filter:**
    *   Returns a single resource specified by the filter in the response.
    *   Example: Return a single Group based on the *displayName* filter.
        *   `GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Groups?filter=displayName eq "myGroupName"`
*   **Attributes:**
    *   Returns only the specified attributes in the JSON response.
    *   Example: Return all Groups with only the *displayName* attribute.
        *   `GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Groups&attributes=displayName`

request.description:
#### **Get Group By Group Id**

**Requirements:** ***Requires CyberArk Password Vault Web Access (PVWA) version 12.2+***

`GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Groups/{{id}}`

Each Group object has a unique Group Id (attribute id) generated by the SCIM server, which you can find in the response payload of a GET request to [https://myTenantUrl.scim/v2/Groups](https://myTenantUrl.scim/v2/Groups). Adding the id attribute value to the Groups endpoint retrieves attributes for just that Group.

#### Permissions Required

*   User Rights
    *   Audit Users

#### Query Parameters

*   **Attributes:**
    *   Returns only the specified attributes in the JSON response.
    *   Example: Return Group 8 with only the *displayName* attribute.
        *   `GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Groups/8&attributes=displayName`

request.description:
DELETE one group deletes a group. The request uses a group ID to locate the group's endpoint. DELETE one group is the only request that returns no information in the HTTP response body. Requesting DELETE twice will yield an error, since the group ID no longer exists.

Deleting a group will not delete the users involved, but will delete the connections the users have to the nonexistent group.

#### **Required Permissions**

*   User Rights
    *   Audit Users
    *   Add/Update Users

#### **Valid Examples**

Delete Group with Group Id 1:

`DELETE https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/Groups/1`

item.description:
CyberArk Identity allows you to manage Group objects in the Vault through the scim/v2/Groups/ endpoint. Supported requests include:

*   GET: access group information
*   POST: add new groups
*   PUT: update the information of existing groups
*   DELETE: delete groups
    

The following should be included in any request to the "Groups" endpoint:  
`"schemas": [ "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:Group" ],`

### **Group Attributes**

| **Attribute** | **Description** | **Data Type** | **Filter?** | **Sort By?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| displayName | Group Display Name | String | Supported | Supported |
| **members** | Group Members | Complex Array | \- | \- |
| *.value* | Group Member User Id | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.$ref* | Group Member User Path Reference | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.display* | Group Member User Display Name | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| id | Unique User Id | String | Not Supported (1) | Not Supported |
| schemas | User Schemas | String Array | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| **meta** | User Metadata | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.resourceType* | Static - "User" | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.created* | Date Created -YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.123456Z | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.lastModified* | Date Last Modified -YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.123456Z | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.location* | Resource Location URL | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| **urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:cyberark:1.0:Group** | CyberArk Group Identifier | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.directoryType* | Directory Type | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.directoryName* | Directory Name | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |

**Notes:**

1.  Support for filter by Id is provided using basic filtering (e.g. `{{identityBaseUrl}}/scimv/v2/Groups?id={{groupId}}`)

item.description:
CyberArk Identity allows you to manage Container (Safe) objects in the Vault through the scim/v2/Containers/ endpoint. Supported requests include:

*   GET: access containers (safes) information
*   POST: add new containers (safes)
*   PUT: update the information of existing containers (safes)
*   DELETE: delete containers (safes)
    

The following should be included in any request to the "Containers" endpoint:  
`"schemas": [ "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:pam:1.0:Container" ],`

### **Container Attributes**

| **Attribute** | **Description** | **Data Type** | **Filter?** | **Sort By?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | Container Name | String | Supported | Supported |
| displayName | Container Display Name | String | Supported | Supported |
| type | Resource Type | String | Not Supported | Supported (2) |
| **owner** | Container Owner | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.value* | Container Owner User Id | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| *.$ref* | Container Owner Reference Url | String | Supported (1) | Not Supported |
| *.display* | Container Owner Display Name | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| **privilegedData** | Privileged Data | Complex Array | \- | \- |
| *.value* | Privileged Data Id | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| *.$ref* | Privileged Data Reference Url | String | Supported (1) | Not Supported |
| *.display* | Privileged Data Display Name | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| schemas | Container Schemas | String Array | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| id | Unique Container Id | String | Supported | Supported |
| **meta** | Container Metadata | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.resourceType* | Static - "Container" | String | Supported (2) | Supported (2) |
| *.created* | Date Created - YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.#######Z | String | Supported | Supported |
| *.lastModified* | Date Last Modified - YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.#######Z | String | Supported | Supported |
| *.location* | Resource Location URL | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| **urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:cyberark:1.0:Safe** | CyberArk Container Identifier | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.NumberOfDaysRetention* | Previous Version Privileged Data Retention Days | Integer | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.ManagingCPM* | CPM Assigned to Container | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |

#### Notes

*   *(1) You should enclose the attribute path in quotes to avoid Url encoding issues (e.g. "owner.$ref")*
*   *(2) Although these are supported, the returned results do not differ from a standard request as the value is not unique per Container*

item.description:
CyberArk Identity allows you to manage Container (Safe) Permissions objects in the Vault through the scim/v2/ContainerPermissions/ endpoint. Supported requests include:

*   GET: access container (safe) permission information
*   POST: add new container (safe) permission
*   PUT: update the information of existing container (safe) permission
*   DELETE: delete container (safe) permission
    

***Note:*** *The Container Permissions Id attribute is a combination of the Container Name and the Object Name with associated permission. The Object Name should refer to a User or Group. The Container Permissions Id may be retrieved using the Get Container Permissions request or may be generated manually.*

The following should be included in any request to the "Container Permmissions" endpoint:  
`"schemas": [ "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:pam:1.0:ContainerPermission" ],`

### **Container Permissions Attributes**

| **Attribute** | **Description** | **Data Type** | **Filter?** | **Sort By?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **container** | Container Details | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.value* | Container Id (1) | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| *.$ref* | Container Path Reference | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.name* | Container Name (1) | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| *.display* | Container Display (1) | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| **user** | User Details for Container | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.value* | User Id | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| *.$ref* | User Path Reference | String | Supported (2) | Not Supported |
| *.display* | User Display Name | String | Supported | Not Supported |
| rights | Container Permissions for User | String Array |  | Not Supported |
| schemas | Container Schemas | String Array | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| id | Unique ContainerPermissions Id (containerName:userName) (3) | String | Not Supported | Supported |
| **meta** | Container Permissions Metadata | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.resourceType* | Static - "ContainerPermission" | String | Not Supported | Supported |
| *.created* | Date Created - YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.#######Z | String | Not Supported | Supported |
| *.lastModified* | Date Last Modified - YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.######Z | String | Not Supported | Supported |
| *.location* | Resource Location URL | String | Not Supported | Supported |
| **urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:cyberark:1.0:SafeMember** | CyberArk Safe Member Identifier | Complex | \- | \- |

##### Notes:
*   *(1) Container Value, Name, and Id are typically the same string in most scenarios.*
*   *(2) You should enclose the attribute path in quotes to avoid Url encoding issues (e.g. "user.$ref").*
*   *(3) If the Container Name or User Name has a space you may have issues filtering based on the value. (e.g. "Notification Engine" shows up as "Notification Engine" in the id attribute)*

item.description:
CyberArk Identity allows you to manage Privileged Data (Accounts) objects in the Vault through the scim/v2/PrivilegedData/ endpoint. Supported requests include:

*   GET: access Privileged Data information
*   POST: add new Privileged Data
*   PUT: update the information of existing Privileged Data
*   PATCH: modify the information of existing Privileged Data
*   DELETE: delete Privileged Data
    

The following should be included in any request to the "PrivilegedData" endpoint:  
`"schemas": [ "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:pam:1.0:PrivilegedData","urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:cyberark:1.0:PrivilegedData" ],`

### **Privileged Data Attributes**

| **Attribute** | **Description** | **Data Type** | **Filter?** | **Sort By?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | Privileged Data Name | String | Supported | Supported |
| type | Privileged Data Type (1) | String | Supported | Supported |
| schemas | Container Schemas | String Array | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| id | Unique PrivilegedData Id | String | Supported (2) | Supported |
| **meta** | Container Permissions Metadata | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.resourceType* | Static - "PrivilegedData" | String | Supported | Supported |
| *.created* | Date Created - YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.#######Z | String | Supported | Supported |
| *.lastModified* | Date Last Modified - YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.######Z | String | Supported | Supported |
| *.location* | Resource Location URL | String | Supported | Supported |
| **urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:cyberark:1.0:PrivilegedData** | CyberArk Privileged Data Identifier | Complex | \- | \- |
| *.safe* | Safe Name | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *.properties* | Privileged Data Properties | Complex Array | \- | \- |
| *..key* | Privileged Data Properties Key (3) | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |
| *..value* | Privileged Data Properties Value | String | Not Supported | Not Supported |

##### Notes

*   *(1) Example types: password, key*
*   *(2) The Privileged Data Id should be put in quotes as the underscore may cause issues with Url encoding.*
*   *(3) Example Property Keys: address, username, platformId, secret*

item.name: SCIM Server Details

request.description:
SCIM provides a schema for representing the service provider's configuration, identified using the following schema URI:

> urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:ServiceProviderConfig

The service provider configuration resource enables a service provider to discover SCIM specification features in a standardized form as well as provide additional implementation details to clients. All attributes have a mutability of "readOnly". Unlike other core resources, the "id" attribute is not required for the service provider configuration resource.

request.description:
The "ResourceType" schema specifies the metadata about a resource type. Resource type resources are READ-ONLY and identified using the following schema URI:

> urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:ResourceType

The following example is a GET request to the /scim/ResourceTypes endpoint.

`GET https://myTenantUrl/scim/v2/ResourceTypes`

request.description:
This section defines a way to specify the schema in use by resources available and accepted by a SCIM service provider. For each "schemas" URI value, this schema specifies the defined attribute(s) and their characteristics (mutability, returnability, etc). For every schema URI used in a resource object, there is a corresponding "Schema" resource. "Schema" resources are not modifiable, and their associated attributes have a mutability of "readOnly". Except for "id" (which is always returned), all attributes have a "returned" characteristic of "default". Unless otherwise specified, all schema attributes are case insensitive. These resources have a "schemas" attribute with the following schema URI:

> urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:Schema

Unlike other core resources, the "Schema" resource MAY contain a complex object within a sub-attribute, and all attributes are REQUIRED unless otherwise specified.

A GET request to the /scim/v2/Schemas endpoint returns attributes for all objects.
